question: You have a full-time job and you are also doing a part-time evening course.You now find that you cannot continue the course.Write a letter to your teachers. In your letterdescribe the situationexplain why you cannot continue at this timesay what action you would like to takeYou do NOT need to write any addresses.Begin your letter as follows:Dear ................. ,
text: Dear Mr Black and Mr Hawkins,

I am writing this letter to inform you that I have to discontinue your evening class "Introduction to Business Analysis". I enjoyed the lectures from you about all the background theories of business analysis, tools and techniques of data analysis and visualization. Unfortunately, in an unfavourable situation, I will not be able to join your classes anymore.

Early this month, the new management team of my company introduced a shift system to all the employees. They have been thinking of deploying this system since the early months of the Covid-19 pandemic. Although it will not extend the business hours of each employee, we are going to have randomized working hours every weekday. So, I will no longer be able to confirm that I will be available during class times.

Although I am no longer able to continue the class at the moment, I do not want you to refund my tuition fees. Instead, I would like to join a similar class on weekends in the upcoming batch. Despite I have learnt 15% of your lectures, I am more than happy to start over from the beginning.

Lastly, I am sorry for all these unnecessary arrangements, I hope you will give my request some consideration and I am sure I will learn at my best if I get a chance to shift to the upcoming weekend class.
